thread.title: Jeremy McConnell deletes This Morning interview AND negative comments off Facebook after backlash
thread.title_full: Jeremy McConnell deletes This Morning interview AND negative comments off Facebook after backlash

author: Alistair McGeorge
title: Jeremy McConnell deletes This Morning interview AND negative comments off Facebook after backlash
text:
Jeremy McConnell deletes This Morning interview AND negative comments off Facebook after backlash The star had uploaded a clip from his tell-all interview earlier this week Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Jeremy McConnell given DNA test on This Morning Share this video   Thank you for subscribing!   
Jeremy McConnell appears to have given up in the face of backlash over his candid interview on ITV's This Morning earlier this week. 
The tattooed reality star appeared on the programme to talk to hosts Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby about Stephanie Davis and the chances he's the father of her newborn baby boy. 
After the deep conversation, he uploaded a clip from the interview to his Facebook page, but was quickly met with a barrage of negative comments from viewers and fans. (Photo: Instagram/Jeremy McConnell) (Photo: Instagram/Jeremy McConnell) 
In between foul-mouthed insults, one person wrote: "God he will do anything for abit of publicity!! He's a first class t***er (sic)" 
Another commented: "Said he would of been at the birth .... was in Thailand getting smashed ! Dad of the year (sic)" (Photo: Instagram/Jeremy McConnell) (Photo: Instagram/Jeremy McConnell) 
After the strongly-worded backlash, Jeremy appeared to first delete all the negative responses - before then removing the post itself. Jeremy McConnell (Photo: Rex Features) Stephanie Davis (Photo: WENN.COM) 
She then shared screengrabs of previous comments the Irish model has made on social media denying he could be the dad after he told Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield that he'd never said that. 
"Stephanie has felt humiliated by Jeremy denying his own son and foolishly announcing publicly his request for a DNA test," the statement read. 
"Jeremy has caused Stephanie massive amounts of stress, pressure and upset throughout her pregnancy, ruining what for most women is one of the most special time[s] of their lives." 
We have contacted a rep for Jeremy for comment. Like us on Facebook
